column2: Women's Status Laws determine which women, if any, you can appoint to council positions, which gender laws are available, and whether women can hunt or lead troops. Departing from traditional gender norms costs large amounts of piety, and is unpopular with religious authorities.
Women's status is determined solely by the traditions of your §Y[Root.Culture.GetName]§! Culture and §Y[Root.Religion.GetName]§! Religion
Although women are seen as less than men, in the shadows blood-ties, trust, and connections count for far more\n

Although women are seen as less than men, married women, widows and women religious are recognised as equals in the arts of truck and barter, due their role in the management of their husband's or religion's estates\n
Although most women are seen as less than men, the most powerful and well connected noble women are recognised as equals in those arts not barred to them by the frailty of their flesh\n
Although most women are seen as less than men, the most powerful and well connected noble women are recognised as true equals\n
(§G*§!) §Y[Root.GetSpymasterName]§!: Allow female dynasty, female consorts & lovers\n
(§RX§!)§Y[Root.GetSpymasterName]§!: Allow female dynasty, female consorts & lovers\n
(§G*§!) §Y[Root.GetChancellorName]§!: Allow wife, mother, female dynasty & women holding landed titles\n
(§RX§!) §Y[Root.GetChancellorName]§!: Allow wife, mother, female dynasty & women holding landed titles\n
(§G*§!) §Y[Root.GetMarshalName]/Lead Troop§!: Allow wife, mother, female dynasty & women holding landed titles\n
(§RX§!) §Y[Root.GetMarshalName]/Lead Troops§!: Allow wife, mother, female dynasty & women holding landed titles\n
(§Y-§!) §Y[Root.GetMarshalName]/Lead Troops§!: Allow female rulers to lead their own troops\n
(§G*§!) §YGrand Hunts§!: Can be held by §YChristian§! & §YPagan§! women rulers\n
(§RX§!) §YGrand Hunts§!: Can be held by §YChristian§! & §YPagan§! women rulers\n
(§G*§!) §YFurusiyya§!: Can be held by §YMuslim§! women rulers\n
(§RX§!) §YFurusiyya§!: Can be held by §YMuslim§! women rulers\n
(§G*§!) §YNerge§!: Can be held by ruling §YKhatun§! of §YMongol§! Empires\n
(§RX§!) §YNerge§!: Can be held by ruling §YKhatun§! of §YMongol§! Empires\n
- §G25%§! of standard cost as §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is both §Y[Root.Culture.GetName]§!, and §Y[Root.Religion.GetName]§!\n
- §G37.5%§! of standard cost as §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is both §Y[Root.Culture.GetName]§!, and §Y[Root.Religion.GetName]§!\n

§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be recognised as a §GWorld Historic Figure§!\n

Now that I have revised the laws regarding the Status of Women, those of them having good and noble character are treated with a §Ggreater respect§! in the lands of my demesne.\n\nAlthough as my vassal, your lands are yours to govern as you see fit, I commend the virtues of this revised law to you.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] respects the abilities of women...as do I
It is good that [From.GetTitledFirstName] follows our lead
This will end badly, but as a loyal [Root.GetTitle] I follow my [From.GetTitle]
I am sickened by such disrespect of our traditions!
How could any dispute a decision such as this?

Now that I have revised the laws of my demesne regarding the Status of Women, their previous mistaken elevation above their natural station is §Rbeing corrected§!.\n\nAlthough as my vassal, your lands are yours to govern as you see fit, I commend the virtues of this revised law to you.
It is good that [From.GetTitledFirstName] follows our lead
This is will end badly, but as a loyal [Root.GetTitle] I follow my [From.GetTitle]
I am sickened by such disrespect of women!!
How could any dispute a decision such as this?
your Status of Women law is the same as your liege
your Status of Women law is more restrictive than your liege
your Status of Women law is more permissive than your liege
Vassals and courtiers are informed of the law change\n
Since women have some status in the §Y[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]§! you may ask your husband to join your dynasty and help ensure the continuation of your name.
I have decided to implement the True Cognatic succession law.
